resources.string: to create space for UI purposes
This guide is here to help you get acquainted with the features and functionalities of this app. PocketLab is an application that allows you to perform scientific experiments on the go.

First, you need to create a new user account. Please store your username and password as PocketLab is currently still under development, and there is no easy way to restoring access to your account once credentials have been lost. So please, store them accordingly.Once you have created an account, the real fun begins!
At our home page, you will find everything you will need in your scientific journey. The menus include, New Experiment, Saved Sessions, Guide (This is where you are now!) and logout.
How To Start A New Experiment

To start a new experiment simply click on the "New Experiment" button. In this menu you will find the available sensors at your disposal, currently color, temperature, ambient light, and custom sensor option. You will also find the option to save your current experiment as a CSV (More on this later).
Click the "Saved Sessions" button to find all previous experiments, allowing you to pick up where you left off in any previous session.
The following describes the current available sensors on our app.

he color sensor utilizes a custom camera that allows you to take an image and create a field where you can select any pixels within the created frame and retrieve the RGB and LGB color value. Such feature is great for determining if your fruit is ripe enough for a delicious bite.
Ever wonder what the current temperature is in your environment? Simply select this sensor and find out. The sensor also has cool graphical representation of your temperature value.
The ambient light allows you retrieve the amount of lumens in your room or outdoors. The scale is between 3 to 55000 lumens.

Have another analog tester that you would like to utilize? Simply select the variable sensor and configure for your use. Mostly all analog pins utilize three pins, voltage, ground, and data output. The custom sensor feature allows you to select which pins on the IOIO-OTG to set to which variable.
PocketLab sensors return a 30 millisecond average of the selected sensor data. For a new data point, simply select “New Data” for the new average.
Where does all this data go?
Save data simply saves the current data value temporarily. For long term storage, see Save to CSV.
This features takes your saved data and permanently saves them to a CSV file in your local storage, such as: Local/android/data/data/com.akanksha.pocketlab.
When you\'re ready to be done...
Just hit the logout button on the main menu! It is sad the fun must stop, but thank you for using PocketLab! We look forward to seeing you during your next experiment.
For more in-detailed guidance of PocketLab, please see the official PocketLab user manual.
